Class BackgroundMusicManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.audio.BackgroundMusicManager
public final class BackgroundMusicManager extends Object
Singleton helper that loops menu / gameplay music, exposes quick FX triggers, and gracefully handles missing assets. All audio retrieval happens lazily, so missing WAV files or codec issues simply disable the respective sound instead of crashing the UI. Calls are marshalled to the JavaFX thread to keep Media APIs happy.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static BackgroundMusicManager getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the music manager.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance

    • setEnabled

      public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables looping BGM. Disabling will stop the active clip immediately.
      Parameters:
      enabled - whether BGM should be audible

    • playMenuTheme

      public void playMenuTheme()
      Switches to the menu theme (looping).

    • playGameTheme

      Switches to the gameplay loop.

      public void playLineClear()
      Plays the one-shot line clear sound if available.

    • setMasterVolume

      public void setMasterVolume(double volume)
      Updates the global master volume (0.0 - 1.0) and reapplies it to the cached clips.
      Parameters:
      volume - normalized volume

    • stopBackgroundMusic

      public void stopBackgroundMusic()
      Stops the currently playing background loop, if any.
